definition: to critique/to voice concerns about/ancient form of acupuncture using sharp stones as needles
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
variant of 針|针[zhen1], needle
ancient stone acupuncture needle/to criticize/to pierce

sentences.english: He who can take advice is sometimes superior to him who can give it.
sentences.chinese: 能担当针砭的有时比赐与者更强。

sentences.english: Next has the ancient form of acupuncture evil of the age's practical significance.
sentences.chinese: 其次具有针砭时弊的现实意义。

sentences.english: The Onion's articles comment on current events, both real and fictional.
sentences.chinese: 《洋葱》的文章针砭时事，亦真亦假。

sentences.english: He started to become more self-conscious to regard letter as the weapon to condemn the social abuses.
sentences.chinese: 他开始更加自觉的将文字视作针砭时弊的武器。

sentences.english: Marx gave us some advice on how to learn foreign languages.
sentences.chinese: 马克思就怎样学习外语给了我们一些针砭箴规。

definition: ills of the day/contemporary problems
parable/allegory/satire
penetrated/trenchant/incisive
to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
to criticize/critique/CL:個|个[ge4]
to borrow the past as a model for the present
to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)
(literary) to remonstrate with one's superior tactfully
to lash/to castigate
to attack (verbally or in writing)
to criticize/to refute
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
current trends/the present situation/how things are going
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
sharp criticism
